Tired of juggling multiple platforms to deploy your apps? Wish there was a single, self-hosted solution that could handle everything from static sites to complex web apps? Then get ready to meet ZaneOps, the all-in-one platform that's about to revolutionize your deployment workflow! ZaneOps is an open-source project that lets you host practically anything â€“ static sites, web apps, databases, services (like Supabase, WordPress, or Ghost), and even serverless functions â€“ all from one beautifully designed dashboard.  Imagine a world where deploying your next big project is as simple as a few clicks, without the headaches of managing multiple servers or wrestling with complicated configurations. That's the promise of ZaneOps.  It leverages the power of Docker Swarm for scalability and Caddy for flexibility, giving you the best of both worlds.  Think of it as your own personal, infinitely customizable cloud, running right on your infrastructure.  No more vendor lock-in, no more expensive monthly bills â€“ just pure, unadulterated control over your deployments.  The setup is surprisingly straightforward. Once it's up and running, the intuitive dashboard makes managing your projects a joy.  You'll be able to monitor your apps, scale resources, and even manage your users all from a single, centralized location.  ZaneOps isn't just about ease of use, though.  It's about empowering developers with the tools they need to build and deploy amazing applications without the hassle.  This is a game-changer for anyone who's ever felt bogged down by the complexities of modern deployment.  By streamlining the process and providing a unified platform, ZaneOps frees you up to focus on what matters most: building incredible software.  And because it's open-source, you have complete transparency and the ability to customize and extend the platform to meet your specific needs.  So, if you're tired of the complexities of managing multiple deployment platforms, or if you're looking for a powerful, flexible, and self-hosted solution that puts you in control, then ZaneOps is the answer.
